text: Can't go wrong with a brick oven pizza and a $3 glass of wine. It's become a quick favorite in our house.  -S.

You need to understand that the owners are French. Once you compliment them, then you get great service. ") People, stop putting down a restaurant that serves great food just because you think the owners are uppity.  If they offer a dish and don't mention the price, ASK!  Don't blame the establishment.

I've been here a few times.  I've tried a lot of their pizza which seems to be their specialty.  I've had pasta there - not so good.  For the 4 stars - it's all about the PIZZA!  The crust is perfect and the toppings are fresh and they don't skimp.  I've had a few salads there as well and they are pretty good too.   I've had their sangria 3 times - first time it was GREAT, the next two times it was so/so -- a bit too sweet.  Beef Carpaccio was really very good!    I'd really give it 3 1/2 stars but couldn't figure out the 1/2 star mark ... so factor that into my rating as well  : )

I have to say one of the best hidden spots on the north side of Scottsdale. Wood fired pizza, crispy on the outside and chewy in the middle, served with infused oil and Parmesan.  The first time I went, I was a little confused by the counter ordering system but otherwise the service was friendly, prompt,and gracious. Rotisserie free range chicken with salad and pomme Gaufrette is a huge and delicious portion of tender, roasted poultry and can be considered a signature dish, next to the pizza. The sandwiches are good and the Nicoise salad is excellent, even if the dressing was underseasoned. Overall a great place for some post-movie munchies!

I'm honestly teetering between 2 and 3 stars, but I think I've got to go with 2, because I left thinking, "eh, it was ok, but it could have been so much better."  Some positives: 1. Great location for going to a movie at the Harkins theater at Scottdale 101 2. Great ambiance. 3. Attentive & clean cut waitstaff. 4. Bread made on location is a GREAT touch.  Negatives: 1. I went with a friend. I ordered the French Dip, she ordered a vegetarian pizza. My sandwich was out a full 5 minutes before her pizza. That's not acceptable in my book.  2. The French dip was over-salted, and the meat tasted slightly old.  3. The friend I was with took a bit of time to figure out what she wanted, and the guy who kept checking back to get our order was visibly irritated. I'll be honest that had I been our waiter, I'd have been a bit irritated too... but I wouldn't have shown it so blatantly.  4. There was maybe 2.5 to 3 oz of meat on my sandwich... a $13 sandwich!   5. The sandwich came with fries that were clearly frozen fries, not made on site. I can't believe they go to the trouble to make their own bread, but order in fries. What a difference that would have made if they made their own fries... or at least ordered in a better frozen brand. For roughly the same price for a sandwich at the Green House, I get MUCH better fries.  6. The side salad accompanying the sandwich was bitter. If you're using bitter greens, you need to compensate with a different (sweeter) dressing. The salad was really just "blah".  Because my food was sub par given the price, and the service was just not what I'd call "A-OK", I'm giving this a two star. In all honesty, it wouldn't take much to get up to 3 or even 4 stars. But it's those little extra steps that take so much effort and a diligent management.  I had SO wanted to like this place too.

Cafepino takes every opportunity possible to inflate your bill.  Our server asked us if we would like bread brought to to the table and then added $2.50 to our bill for it.  The specials were read to us.  I ordered the salad that was on special that was described as, "Mixed greens topped with  warm grilled seasonal vegetable and chicken breast.  Imagine my shock when I received the bill and was charged $19.50 for salad!!  I was billed $15.00 for salad and an additional $4.50 for the chicken!   I went in for a quick bite with my two kids before a movie and ended up with a $75 bill!!!  Will never go back.

Seems like this restaurant has changed ownership. It used to be a lovely Italian cafe with nice food and reasonable prices. However- beware: the new owners charged my friends $4+tax for a cup of tea (really?) and I was asked to pay $8 for a very bland soy cappuccino. What a rip-off! Not going back! And the service was pretty unfriendly on top of everything ( because we didn't order any food we assumed). Absolutely NOT recommended.

Stopped in to kill some time for a glass and an appetizer whilst waiting for a movie time. Found the place overpriced - $18 for a grilled vegetable plate of no particular distinction. Really? Service was of the Lower-East-Side-of-NY variety, brusque and a little in your face. Not a pleasant experience.

Never, Never, Never step foot in here!!!In my 66 years in this world I have never experienced a co owner that cried I hate you, this business, and humanity as a whole.  It's taken a month for me to settle down and write this review, but now I can review this place rationally without emotion. We did not have a reservation, but decided after a night at the movies we would just walk in and take our chances. We waited 40 minutes, but that was ok. When we were seated, we waited 15 minutes before the owner came around, running by our table, only to brake stop and say are you ready to order. Since waiting fur the fifteen minutes, I asked for some water and he tersely said, you would have to wait another ten minutes for him to come back for our order if we got water. We said we were ready to order after that statement! I then asked if I could get a half order of the meat platter and he rolled his eyes in disgust. I then went with the kakabobs. Two small skeweres later with a half a cup of tossed salad cost me $ 14.00 and were marginal at best. We asked if they served bread we were brought some prior to our meal.  The check came and I noticed we were charged$3.00 for 4 slices of bread. I brought it to co owners attention and he said they have been charging for the bread since they opened years ago. Then it happened, he says, You are not happy here, all of you, Never come back again. You are not welcome here.  My friend, could not believe what he was hearing and went over to the other owner and explained what happened and how rude this guy was to us.  Even as we walked out the rude owner pointed me out and said that he had an issue with me and I was not welcome and there are plenty of other restaurants I can go to He's got that right!!!!! He took lessons from the Seinfeld, Soup Nazi personality wise...except the food is simply not worth the bother!!!

My wife and I stopped in to the restaurant after a movie to have a late dinner. This was the first time we had dined here (and the last)! The food was decent, however we found it to be somewhat pricey for what you got.  When the check came, I noticed that the price of my wife's entree was more than the price listed on the menu. I pointed it out to the bartender who just happened to pick up the check and credit card. He stated that they are in the process of getting new menus and the new ones with the new prices won't be in until next week. Not really sure how that was my problem. He said he would mention it to the manager. When my CC receipt was returned, by someone completely different, nothing was mentioned about the price differences AND there was no adjustment on the check. I was furious.  I called over someone who I guessed was the manager. He was a bald guy with an accent and I am guessing it's the same guy who is referenced in this review  ( http://tinyurl.com/28smh9j ). I told him my issue and he says he was aware, but that we had picked up old menus and the new price was over there - on a chalk board. First, this is a completely different story than the bartender told us. The 'manager' was implying that it was our fault that we got the old menus. How is it our fault, when the person who seated us handed us these menus?  Secondly, how anyone is supposed to know to look at the 'chalkboard' for the real prices is beyond me. What about the people who ate outside on the patio. They couldn't see the chalkboard prices! Anyway, he continued with his arrogant, nonchalant and careless attitude and stated that I should withhold the money from the tip and next time, "if there is a next time" dessert was on him! Excuse me!    As a former restaurant manager for a very highly respected and well known restaurant I can tell you what happened to my wife and me is beyond comprehension from a customer service standpoint. Given that the restaurant is so closely located to the movie theater, their attitude seems to be that customers are a dime a dozen and they don't need to focus on any sort of customer service.  We will never return and I hope my review serves as 'food for thought' for those considering eating here. Caveat emptor!
Excellent Restaurant..... Great Pizza! Absolutely loved the Ambiance. ... I Highly highly recommend it!

Love the decor. Love the food. Love the owners.  Yes, it is on the pricey side but a) you are in scottsdale and b) you get what you pay for - the food is high quality! The freshest mozzarella is used in their salads, pizza etc and the desserts are outstanding (the tirimisu and macaroons specifically)  Love it! I'll be back often!

This is a great neighborhood spot and the perfect place to grab a bite before or after a movie at the Harkins Cine Capri.  The restaurant is bright, casual, and modern, the owners are friendly, and the service is quick and attentive.  They serve salads, pizzas, sandwiches, and pastas - you order at the counter and then they bring it out to your table.  Some of their salads are better than others  - the Caesar is pretty good, while the grilled chicken salad was mediocre and overpriced (at $12), with just warm lettuce, shredded carrots, and dry chicken in too much peanut sauce.  Their pizzas are very tasty, with a delicate, chewy crust, plenty of sweet, delicious sauce, and very fresh cheese and other ingredients.  My only complaint is that the crust underneath towards the center of their pizzas is too soggy - I love thin crust, but it shouldn't collapse and make all your ingredients slide off when you try to take a piece.  Cafepino has become one of my go-to spots for a reliably good, quick meal.

Great for al fresco dining, friendly staff, and brilliant food. If they didn't sweeten the tomato sauce I think this pizza would have been absolutely perfect... pity about that. Salad was also very tasty but desert (we had Tiramisu) was dissapointing.

I hate to be picky about a local place but I wouldn't go back.  The only thing positive is the decor.   The pizza was super marginal, greasy, and the bread on my sandwich was really chewy. The wine tasted like vinegar for $9 a glass.  My sandwich came to the table 5 minutes before the wifes pizza.  Service never checked on us, restaurant was slow on a Saturday night, except to give us the bill and process the payment.  Hate that.  Really wanted to like this place but wont be back.  Two stars only because they are local.

Decor is nice and gets it extra stars. Definitely overpriced for what it is. The wait staff practically bullied us to order some wine. Different people, including the owner, kept coming to our table and abruptly asking, "what are you drinking?"  They walked away a little rudely when we initially didn't order anything. I didn't like the overall feel of the place due to the waitstaff and felt that they were trying to nickle and dime us by getting us to add extra things to our order. The home-made pasta was good, but overall simple and not worth the over $15 price tag.  I won't return due to the attitude of the owner and servers, and the overpricing. We ended up paying over $30 per person for our meals, which is too much for a very average meal with poor service.

When we first moved across the street, we called over to see if they had an online menu so that we could order takeout (we have a very active toddler so eating out isn't always worth the trouble). The owner answered and said that he was "too old school" for an online menu but encouraged us to come in. Annoying, but okay fine.  Earlier today, I went in to pick up a takeout menu (they have a parking spot specifically for takeout so I was assuming they did a lot of takeout business) and they laugh and tell me that "they don't do takeout menus." What's the point of offering takeout if you're not going to offer your customers a menu?? Heard bad things about the customer service and didn't want to believe them. Wish that I could taste the food, but with the bad attitude, I won't be a customer.

Went to Cafe Pino recently with a friend for Sunday lunch. The location is easy to find as it is right next to the Harkins theatre on Scottsdale 101. The restaurant is quite spacious with both indoor and outdoor seating and a decent ambience.  We ordered a tuna salad and a vegeterian pizza with extra topping of mushroom (the mushroom made the difference , I felt, but then again i like mushrooms on everything italian). Both the dishes were very good. The salad was very fresh and had a good dressing and the pizza was also the right crist size and flavorful.  Had a tirmisu for dessert which was also good , but not the best I have ever eaten.  All in all ..good service, good food and had a nice time. Gave it 3 stars instead of higher simply because I personally didnt feel there was anything else on the menu I was dying to try so may take a while to come back here. But certainly worth a try.
The asparagus soup is amazing. Sandwiches as good as Pane Bianco. Any chance a second location could be put in Ahwatukee/Tempe?

Went there after a movie for a quick bite with friends.  While the food was good, the manager/owner is beyond brusque, bordering on rude.  Made for an uncomfortable dining experience.  Surprising they stay in business with such crappy customer service in a town filled with excellent restaurants.  I won't be going back anytime soon.

The service was terrible.  The bald french guy who seated us is incredibly rude and uncaring.  The food is overpriced and very mediocre.  I ordered a chicken salad with peanut sauce that was overpowering and the lettuce was limp.My wife had the Pino burger, which is basically a hamburger on flat bread.It was hard and overcooked.  I would not recommend Cafe Pino to anyone.  You are better off going to the Elephant Bar.

I recommend this place.    Three of us went on a Saturday night arriving about 8 PM and there was no wait for a table.  We sat outside on the patio because after a few minutes sitting inside we were all freezing.  Turn up the thermostat!   We were glad we went out to the patio because it was very nice out there.  It was bordered by nice plants, it was quite, and the lighting was pleasant.  Inside the lighting is bright and somewhat harsh.  The menu is centered around the pizza offerings, of which there were 12, plus three daily specials priced from $9.95 up to $14.95 for the specials.  Many sounded great.  There are 6 sandwiches made on bread made at the restaurant, that all come with french fries and salad.  All sounded good.  Priced from $9.95 to $12.95.  Other offerings are: Beef Minestrone Soup, Beef Carpaccio, Antipasto Pino, Antipasto Mea Culpa, Rotisserie Chicken, Lasagna Bolognese, Grilled Chicken Pasta, Smoked Salmon Pasta.  There are six salads that sounded good; Nicoise, Caesar, Pino Garden, Caprese, Canasta, Grilled Chicken, and a Fresh Fruit Bowl.  Prices were from $6.95 to $11.95.  There are also 5 items on the Kids menu; Chicken Fingers and fries, Pasta Bolognese, Pasta Marinara, Pasta with Butter, and Grilled Cheese.  All $5.75.  We ordered a bottle of Duboeuf Pinot Noir  for $24.  It was pretty good, but not great.    Three of us split a Pino Garden Salad ($6.95)  which was very good.  It was a nice size salad for three people to split with a pizza.  It would have been a lot for one person to eat and have room left for anything else.  We paid $1.75 for bread so we could try the three olive oils they provide for dipping.  We only really liked one of the oils.  Two were kind of plain, lacking the fruity taste we like.  We split one of the three daily special pizzas, the margarita pizza with prosciutto and arugula ($14.95).  We all liked the pizza very much.  The wood fired oven gave the crust the perfect crispness and wood fired flavor we love so much.  The sauce and toppings were very flavorful too.  One person in our group thought she would have liked a little more herb flavor.  My only complaint is that there was a little too much sauce, such that the sauce was running off the pieces and the toppings were sliding off the slices when cutting and trying to lift a piece for a bite.  I found it better to leave the slice on the plate and use a fork for the first few bites.  The sauce also made the crust a little soggy in the center such that it wouldn't support the toppings when you tried to pick up the slice.  Cut the sauce and it would have been perfect.  We ordered one Spumone for desert ($5.95) to split.  It was my first time to try  Spumone.  It was kind of a chocolate and vanilla ice cream pie that is wonderful.  But I would guess it's not ice cream like is made in the USA.  I would highly recommend you try it.  We loved it.  The owner came by our table a few times to say hello and make sure everything was to our liking.   The service is excellent because the owner constantly walks around supervising the staff making sure your every need is taken care of.   Our total bill, before tip, was $58.05 for a bottle of wine, one pizza, one salad, bread, and one Spumone desert.  Cafepino is just to the right of the Cine Capri theatre entrance.  Give it a try.  UPDATE:  On Saturday, October 19 we went back again at 6:30 PM after a movie and we ended up at the end of a line of 30 to 40 people all lined up to place an ordered at the counter, and then get a table.  The first time  we went here they seated us like a normal restaurant.  I guess when they  get a big crowd all at once they have you order at the counter.  We didn't like the program and left.  Too bad.  We really wanted to try another pizza.  Maybe next time.

Ever since we first came to Cafe Pino, wee love this spot! Their Pasta Pastor and Margherita Pizza are fantastic, and the food is authentic Italian. Their dessert and coffee is also great! The place is a little pricey, but definitely delicious. Also they don't serve bread automatically, but if you ask they'll give it to you!

Went for lunch witha friend and had the best coffe and eggs benedict.  The patio seating was enjoyable and even got a little spring sprinkle.  The service was great and the food was tasty.  Can't wait to go back.

Maybe I experienced Cafepino on an 'off' Friday night considering their sever / host couldn't get my order right after 3 attempts / 40 minutes. I was willing to pay $20+ for a pizza in the desert but I did not receive any food! I guess one star is for the refills on the ice water during the debacle.
This place is crazy good. I love the service and the food. You know when the staff speaks italian to one another you are in the right place for authentic food. The sangria is great!

Whether you are going to a movie afterwards or if you are just looking for a good meal, Café Pino is definitely worth a visit.    As many of you are probably thinking, myself included, if a restaurant is going to charge $14 for a personal pizza it better be good.  Fortunately Café Pino is able to back up the prices that they charge by serving consistently good pizzas.  I must say that they have some of the best pizza in the Valley - and since Yelp is providing me with the platform to do so, I will say it.  If pizza isn't your thing, their lasagna is pretty damn good too.    My only word of warning is that if you are eating with 6+ people and everyone orders pizza, their oven doesn't seem to be able to handle an order of that size.

I went today for lunch. The vegetable soup was delicious, the salad was very good...but one bite of the tuna sandwich was a much as I could handle.  When the server approached she asked me if I wanted a box, I said no thank you and said I didn't care for rit.  She rudely responded well if you told me earlier I would have made you another sandwich. I responded as nice as I could, I did not want to stoop to her unprofessionalism and said 'Had somebody come by to check, I would have told them".  Then the owner came over and started to yell at me and let me know he is the only restaurant to make it in this shopping center. I was so embarrassed by his behavior. I would never refer this restaurant or go back!

We visited this restaurant, Cafepino, for the first time last evening.  It was quite noisy and the decor was nothing to write home about.  The waiter was very brusque and hurried.  When I asked to have a few small pieces of fruit instead of the fries that came with my meal, he insisted that I purchase a fruit bowl for $2.98 more.  (Other restaurants in the past have made the substitution.)  I had a grilled veggie sandwich with side salad, no fries, for $13.  The fruit bowl, with a tiny container of yogurt , was $2.98.  The salad was OK but quite small, the toasted bun was burnt and the yogurt tasted spoiled.  The veggies inside the bun were OK, but nothing special.  The fruit was tasteless.  My husband loves fruit, and I was sharing it with him.  We left most of it because it was of such poor quality.  One of our companions had a grilled chicken salad which had very little chicken in it.  When we were finished with our meal, the waiter asked if we were happy with our meals.  I said "No" that I was unhappy with mine.  He immediately walked away, without asking what had been wrong with the meal, or even expressing some kind of apology.  Despite this, we left a 15% tip (we usually tip 20% or more) although I felt he didn't really deserve even that much.  I wrote on the bill some of what had been wrong with my meal and we left.  I would not recommend this restaurant and we will not be returning..
Awesome!  Pizza rocks!  Pasta is great homemade stuff.  Really different than pretty much Italian type restaurants.

Went last night before a movie.  Had read the reviews, but decided to try them anway.  Disappointed in the so/so food and very high prices for the quality and quantity of food.  Felt constantly rushed as the owner/waiter kept coming back to us which gave me a feeling of 'are you ready yet?".  Portions were small for the cost:  lasagna too rich, heavy and cheesy and  small portioned at $14.95 - Really?  Absolutely nothing comes with the meal - no salad, no bread, both extra at $4.95 each.  Foolishly came back after the movie to try one of the tempting desserts pictured in a table card.  When it came to the table we were shocked that it was a fraction of the size.  Very deceiving. Although tasty, nothing special except ice cream covered in choc chips and nuts, and for $6.95.  I would not recommend this place.  There are many better choices where food is genuinely good, prices are reasonable and service exceptional.

Sitting next to the Cine Capri Theater, Cafe Pinot is somewhat of an unknown gem. We love this place and frequent with friends here often. The staff is always friendly and willing to do most anything to make everyone happy and feel special. The food is always fresh and superb. Ownership has always been present whenever we've dined here, which tells me they take a lot of pride in what they do. Any bad reviews on this place have to be random and the rare exception. If you're a coffee snob like myself, they have some of the best in town. Highly recommend the Malaga!

I stopped in here for lunch with my sister around 1:30 on a Tuesday and we were the only people in there.  The service was horrible, I mean we were the only people in there so it was pretty extreme how bad the service was.  The food took forever so I asked for some bread.  What came out were hard pieces of stale bread.  I got the shrimp salad that ended up being 20 dollars with tax.  And to our surprise on the bill the bread cost 2.50!!!!!!!!!!! I was outraged! I will never be returning!

Great food. Good prices. It's a great little taste of europe in town. One of my favorite highlights of the place is they always have a new special. And it's always good. Only downside is fighting movie traffic for parking.

We had two very different experiences at Cafepino.  The first visit was great! My daughter and I were somewhat pressed for time as we had movie tickets so, rather than order a whole salad, we decided to share a Nicoise salad. The salads had already been split in the kitchen when they were brought to the table and they were great. Tasty tuna, huge capers, small green beans and pieces of potato, etc. They had been carefully prepared and were tastefully presented in two bowls. The service was friendly and the food came out of the kitchen quickly.  We were so impressed that we went back two weeks later. My husband came with us. This time we weren't under any time constraints and were prepared to linger a bit. One of us ordered a glass of wine. Unfortunately it was served in a small unattractive glass.  My husband ordered the Grilled Chicken Sandwich which was excellent. We also ordered their Homemade Bread which also was excellent although they charge $1.75 for it. My daughter and I ordered the same Nicoise salad.   Imagine our surprise when only one salad was brought to the table on a plate. We had again opted to share the salad and had assumed it would be split in the kitchen the same way as it had been on our first visit. When we commented, our server told us the salad could not be split in the kitchen. When I said we were just there two weeks earlier and the salad had been split in the kitchen, she said she got into trouble for splitting it the last time and had been sent home. Regardless, I reiterated my request that the salad be split, but my request was denied. Instead, another smaller plate was brought to the table and we were left to muddle through the sharing process on our own. Frankly, the meal was ruined before it began.  It is noteworthy that there were only two or three other people in the entire restaurant and the kitchen could easily have taken the time to accommodate our request but, for whatever reason, chose not to, or someone (a manager or possibly the owner) told them not to.  No one said "thank you" or "goodbye" when we left.  No restaurant, especially in the current economy, can afford to be this cavalier and inflexible as far as its customers are concerned. There are simply too many other restaurant choices.  Finally, their prices are somewhat on the high side. The Nicoise salad and the Grilled Chicken sandwich were $12.95 each.  Although we loved their food, under no circumstances would we ever go back. In fact, we couldn't wait to leave.

I enjoyed a few glasses of wine on the patio one evening while waiting for a friend. However, I was disappointed they didn't inform me of the 1/2 price bottle night. The sign was on the table, but I'm surprised with how slow they were they didn't give me the verbal offer as well.   My friend and I ended up taking advantage of the 1/2 price bottle upon her arrival. We also ordered a margarita pizza. The waiter asked if we wanted garlic on it. He said it's very good with garlic. It should be the best garlic ever cuz we got upsold and charged 2$ extra for adding the garlic!   Overall, I would return b/c I really enjoy the atmosphere!
Excellent food and wine. Open for BL &D. Homemade fresh pasta woodfired pizza stop in for a great meal.

While enjoying the Phoenix Film Festival this weekend Ive made two visits to this very cute restaurant. The service was great both times, once with a party of four and again with a takeout order. The host and servers were very attentive to make sure we made the best selections. The food was good as well; nice variety and good flavors. I will be visiting again!  Hopefully when I'm not in such a rush!

The highlight of my evening.   The sensuous flavor of our meal rolled onto our tongue as we devoured every morsel.   If you have not tried this place,   give it a go.  I loved the atmosphere,  attentive staff and oh I can't forget the food.  Oh the food...MMMM.  Love love love this place!

Thought stopping in to Cafepino was a great idea after taking in a movie- I was wrong. We were 6 starving people on a line waiting and waiting and waiting... I took my Mother to sit at a table while the others were on line, and was asked by a waiter and then a manager, to please leave the table for the next people on the line.  (There were plenty of other empty tables available) - but this is the way they do business...  You CANNOT sit down at a table until your food is ordered.  I was even asked to point out the people on line who were ordering for me , and when I did, (because there were about 10 people in front of my party) ,they said we would have to leave the table until the food was ordered??  Not a good way to do business -  My husband is a VP in the Restaurant -Franchise Food Industry, and feels this was uncalled for... Obviously the six of us left the restaurant and ate at an establishment close by that welcomed us with "open arms" -  JoJoe

Hadn't been here in a long time. The couple other times it was pretty good, and as others have commented, the location is perfect if you want to catch a movie.  At least last night there was no 'line' to wait in. We were seated and given menus - a first. Unfortunately nobody came to take our order for at least 5 minutes (even drinks) until the (I'm guessing) owner wandered over and took our order. The other servers were standing around watching some MMA or fighting stuff.  Caesar salad came right away. Salad was fine, nothing special. We also ordered some 'homemade' bread. Perhaps they should buy their bread - because it was hard and not very good. Reminded me of naan bread, but not as good.   My pizza, the Sicilian, was burned on the bottom. My wife's pizza, a special with prosciutto and arugula, was less burned, but I think they just put the prosciutto on after the pizza comes out. Mmmkay, I'd have guessed it would be cooked on the pizza but whatever...  Then the bill comes. My pizza is listed at $13.95. I was pretty sure it was only $11.95 on the menu. I asked the girl, who instead of looking at a menu on the table next to me, walked to the owner and talked to him. Nope, it's $13.95. Ok, I'm sure I was wrong - would not be a first. As we got up to leave I just thought I'd peek at the menu - my pizza was $12.95. I didn't say anything and just walked out.  SHADY and BAD FOOD. Stay away. Go to Tea Light Cafe instead, just by the Cold Stone and also right by the theatre. Better food and HONEST
Went in ordered a pizza. Waiter asked me if I wanted garlic, I said sure. Got the bill $2.00 added to the bill, Pathetic, -  pizza was very average - Sande s.

The food looks decent but you would have to get pass the incredibly rude owner which has no sense of what service means. Sadly they reinforce the image of the rude Parisian restaurant. Will never set foot in this place again.

When we went into the restaurant, we ordered a half salad, a kid's pizza, and a cookies and cream dessert. The salad was alright, but the pizza and cookies and cream was very good. However, they charged us wrong for every single item. When we told them that they did, they wouldn't comply. We called later to try again, and they still wouldn't help us. We will not be going to the restaurant again.

We stumbled upon the location and the outdoor seating. Finally a family owned and operated buisness here in Scottsdale great service the pasta specials were spot on good and large portions. The cesare salad was good homemade dressing and croutons nice shaved cheese on top!  Thank you Pino

Super yummy food. Great service! We had the large meat and cheese platter even though we are not regular meat and cheese eaters. It was fabulous. Several types of salami and prosciutto and cheeses served with a very delicious crusty bread and excellent fresh fruit. At $28+, it looked expensive, but for a very enjoyable meal for two it was a bargain. I also had a side salad with was great. I loved the quality European style service and attention we received. I will be a regular at Cafepino!
Great food from one of the Co-founders of AJ's grocery stores. Great place to go before a movie and great food.
One of my favorite eateries in Scottsdale. Excellent service, 5 star food and so many personal touches by the owner. Try it!  You'll come back again and again
Crime Brûlée is to die for. Caramel latte macchiato is insanely delicious. FANTASTIC SERVICE!!!!  Prices are are a bit high but I promise you the food, coffe, and service are worth every penny!

Cafe Pino is the sort of place I am totally mixed on. I wanted to love it - cute, conveniently near the movie theater, serves late, broad, well priced wine list. But, my experience here was odd at best.   Went with one of my friends, Meredith G., after a movie. We were never told whether to order at the counter or if we would be waited on, and we basically stood around for a while. Once we ordered, it took a while for the food to be delivered, which was odd b/c we were about the only people there. Also, the owner kept staring at us and coming by every two seconds to ask if we were "ok." This quickly went from friendly to down right annoying.  The pizza and salad we shared was tasty, but the service was a hassle overall.

Stopped in last night after seeing a movie and were pleasantly surprised. To us it was obvious that you order from the counter. After ordering they gave us a number to put on our table. The food came out quickly and was exactly as ordered. We sat on the patio which was lovely, but we were a little to close to the speaker which was too loud so it was difficult to carry on a conversation. It is the perfect type of place near the movie theater. The food was great. The only reasons I did not rate it higher was that it felt too cold to sit inside and the music was a little too loud outside.

I had lunch there this week-The vegetable soup was good, the salad was okay and the Tuna sandwich was awful. I did not know that they prepared it-tuna nicoise and took one bite and stopped eating it. The server came with the check and asked if I needed a box. I politely said no thank you, I did not care for it. She responded very rude and said," had you told me immediately I would have brought you something else". I said back to her, had you checked on me I would have told you. Then the tyrant owner comes over and starts to YELL at me that he is the only restaurant to make it in this shopping center. His food is delicious and I need to pay for this because it is only $8.95. People were staring at him while he was yelling and all I could do was be embarrassed for him.   I am in the Hospitality business and I would never refer nor enter this restaurant again-EVER!!!!!

After reading the reviews from whiners complaining about the prices and service at Cafepino I had to update my review. First of all, the service at Cafepino is better than I have experienced at most restaurants, not only in the valley, but in most of my travels in the US and abroad and at any price point. The staff are mostly charming French men (what's not to like about that?) and they are incredibly attentive, efficient, but not intrusive. I have never experienced a negative attitude or  anything but a warm welcome from the staff and proprietor. As for the prices, yes they are on the pricey side, but all the food is incredibly high quality, fresh and completely made in house, including the pasta and desserts. The owner will whip up a special "house" salad on request to perfectly complement your entree. Last night he surprised us with the Monte Carlo...fresh greens, still warm roasted veggies and a light dressing with flavors to die for. This is not the type of establishment one goes to if they have to pinch pennies. If you want a bargain for your family of four go to a chain restaurant with dodgey ingredients, tasteless food, zero atmosphere, poor service and guaranteed heartburn. Cafepino is fine casual dining and priced accordingly.If you want a nice dining experience for a date night, casual lunch with friends or just a great glass of wine and dessert after a movie, Cafepino is the place to go.
Very bad service. Our food came at different time and we had to wait 15mns for extra bread. Over/priced cheese platter for quality. Very ordinary pizza. Won't go back .
Average at best "Italian" food. Way over priced for the quality of food and service that you receive. I suggest saving your money and going elsewhere.

My husband & I occasionally go to cafepino & love it ! It's cozy, great food & the staff are very attentive . I'm "obsessed" with Europe so I enjoy speaking with the owner who is from France & very engaging . We were there on thanksgiving & thoroughly enjoyed it , we do not like the traditional turkey , however it was available if we wanted it . We sat outside on the patio & the music was perfect . The pasta dishes are excellent !  We will be going there for Christmas also ! It's our little "hidden gem" .

While waiting for a movie we noticeds Cafe Pino, I just wanted to look at the menu but ended up having espresso and tiramisu (and a beer for the husband).  I was going to just have a bite since Im not a big sweet eater however we ate the whole tiramisu!  I loved it!  16 years ago I had a tiramisu and have never found one that compares, until now!  Cant wait to try more from Cafe Pino!  Having lunch there later today!
Came here just to get a glass of wine before a movie, service was awful. Took 15 minutes for the wine to come after ordering, by the time it came I had to chug it to make it to the movie on time.

Really enjoyed the food as always plus great service not to mention the wonderful ambiance.We sat on the beautiful patio this afternoon and had such a great experience . I always recommend Pino to all my friends!!

(Considering this is one of those places that has two different Yelp pages depending on how you spell it, this will be the same review as seen on the alternate spelling/grammar page)  I would give this place one star; however, the decor was nice and the location is handy for a "dinner and a movie" night. (but not handy enough to warrant coming back.....)  The prices were alright, I would expect things to be a little cheaper based on a few things though: .The food was mediocre to bland .The ordering at the counter, yet having a "server" rushing around tables like he was in some sort of relay race is just obnoxious. .No one welcomed us upon entering, after a couple minutes someone asked if we were ready to order or if we needed to look at the board longer  1/4 way through our experience here, we felt like we had already been ripped off.  The food really was nothing exciting at all.  The place itself appears to be in some sort of identity crisis. I mean is it counter service or sit down? You can't be both, it just annoys people.  Meh. My opinion...skip it and just fill up on popcorn or leave early for the movie and go some place else... perhaps with flavor and an identity.  Just a thought.

Amazing gem, hidden adjacent to Harkins CiniCapri, another outstanding theatre and business, meals are very generous in quantity and high quality.   The owners, Guy and Paco, both French, are veterans of many eating and food success with Guy having a CV of amazing depth and impact in the Valley of the Sun. In fact, he was the original owner/creator of the famous French Corner in downtown Phoenix.   Yes the people are interesting and the food is very interesting as well. The variety and depth of the menu excellent.

We chose Cafe Pino because we were early for a movie. We were confused on where to sit and/or if we order first. We questioned a gentleman where would he like us to sit if we were only going to have coffee and wine. He did not seem happy that we only wanted beverages as we chose a counter seat.The person taking our order ( who I now know to be one of the owners) informed me that the coffee item I ordered is only ordered by men and suggested I have something else. Some of us chuckled as we thought he might be joking with us until he let me know he wouldnt serve it to me.. it didnt say for men only in the menu! My grown daughter ordered a coffee drink with hazelnut. The drinks were delivered and then shortly there after a dessert showed up, we told the person delivering the item that we did not order it.  The person called over to the owner who had been hovering between us at the counter and another table, "they said they didnt order it" He came over and insisted we ordered a hazelnut dessert, we indicated she ordered a hazelnut latte.. He argued that he couldnt understand us. He was saying something in a different language that let us know how upset he was. He handed the dish to the person that had delivered it to our table, threw his hands up in the air and said again something in another language.   After that he stood and glared at our party .    I do not care how good any food is at this establishment, he was so rude and rather scary.    Its unfortunate that he has a prime location close to a theater that will draw people in for more of his abuse.

I was there for a lunch w/ a french friend that recommended the place. Like the menu and the place. A little pricey maybe, but they have lunch specials. I ate a pizza and was very good, I also order a cappuccino that they serve exactly how I like.

I have been to Pino twice and have had a pleasant experience both times. The service was great. Many of the servers seems to work as a team to ensure no table was forgotten. The pasta is freshly made and you can definitely tell. They have a good wine selection as well! I will definitely be returning.

I might try this restaurant again, because I love fresh pasta, but on my only visit, the lasagne apparently was placed under a heat lamp.  How else to explain the hard, dried first layer of pasta.  Otherwise, the dish was excellent, with delicious sauce and other layers of pasta much,much better.

The owner is a thug.  They upsell on everything, if you order a tuna nicoise salad they ask if you want anchovies, if you say yes they charge $3.00.  If you are asked if you would like bread, $2.50.  The charges wouldn't be so bad if they told you in advance, but they don't.  The thug owner walks around like he wants to kill somebody, very unpleasant experience for mediocre and not cheap food.

This is the first time my family has completely different opinions about the food. I personally love there thin, crunchy  style pizza. However, for rest my family it was too thin and the crust was too crispy. If you like thin crust pizza then you should definitely try this one.

This food is the closest traditional Italian food that I've had ( after visiting Italy, it's hard to find a spot to live up to my expectations). The owner is very pleasant and has fulfilled all of our requests during every visit, but a greeting upon arrival takes a bit of time...The wait is worth the food, however!

Asked my server what a certain specialty latte was and was told it's only ordered by men and then he wouldn't describe it to me. I'm a gal and this is why he wouldn't describe it in case that wasn't already obvious. Yes, in the year 2015 someone who works with the public thinks it is totally okay to say that apparently. Crazy. Did not have much there foodwise but what I did have was not that great. Won't be going back again due to the odd, rude and very inappropriate service.
When you get offered bread and then get charged for it. ..food was average but overpriced. ..never again!!

I'm surprised by the bad reviews. I actually enjoyed it and it one of the best and authentic Italian restaurant in the valley. The gelato is just like back in Italy and served in a cold bowl as it should be!   service was great but I can see how some might not like it (very direct and sharp like in Italy). For me it all adds to the experience.

The service was terrible and there is this one waiter who was terrible rude the food was not that great they need better service and better attitude   and they need to pay attention because This on waiter poured water into Sprite because she wasn't paying attention

Had dinner at Cafepino last weekend before a movie.  They were able to accommodate our party of five quickly.  Seeing as we were seeing a movie, the staff was quick to take our order and the food came out pretty fast.  I'd have to agree with the comments regarding the owner's abrupt style.  It was a little intimidating, but in the end good food and fast service wins.  We all shared a couple pizzas... the garlic margarita and a sausage.  I loved both, and particularly enjoy when the sausage is crumbled instead of in chunks, so their pizza was spot on.  The garlic pizza was garlicky for sure... they don't skimp.  We also had a pasta, which the owner specially made for us.  I believe it had lamb sausage on it and it was in a tomato sauce with pappardelle noodles.  It was pretty darn good.  Overall, I liked the experience/meal I had at Cafepino.  As a regular movie goer, I'd fully consider stopping in to Cafepino again before a flick.

2 drinks, one salad, one bread and one appetizer for $60. Are you kidding me. A small dinner portion salad, ceviche that dis not have marinated shrimp and 2.50 for a small bread. We are used to pay for great food and small portions but not small salads by a movie theatre. No wonder the owners are just hanging out and the place is not as busy for a Friday night. Shame on you for treating your customers like this.

Consistently euphoric. Everything is always so fresh it tastes likes the salads were just picked ripe from the garden and all the dishes I've had (which is a lot bc i come fairly l regularly) are always intricately flavorful.  You can definitely taste the French influence and appreciation for freshness and artful preparation. If you don't absolutely love this place, I'm sorry but it's most likely because you aren't cultured and probably should go to a place like Golden Corral  or dominos pizza because you've never developed your palate for anything outside fast food or chain restaurant junk.

Giving it 2 stars cause my family enjoyed the food, but otherwise not a great experience at all. I have sent many people here before I even tried it myself due to it being across the street from my work and I've heard good things. Well today, the 1 time a year my family is here together we were very disappointed with the service. Each one of our meals came out separately...so here we are together, the 1 time a year we get and we didn't even get to eat together:( my nephews meal came out last when he ordered a medium done burger, it came out extra well. So not only were we all done eating, but his meal was not cooked as ordered.  After today's experience I will no longer refer my residents there, and I manage the community across the street.

We stopped into Cafe Pino for drinks before heading to the movie theater next door. The host was very polite and offered us a table but we decided to sit at the small bar, since we wouldn't be long. We both ordered a grey goose & tonic with lime. They did not have lime, which is okay, but the drink was weak (less than an ounce pour) and the tonic was starting to go flat. We should have sent the drinks back but we didn't because we wanted to get to our movie. The worst part is when we got the bill ... They charged us $12 per drink! I know this is Scottsdale but that is way too high for a mediocre cocktail. Especially when we could have gotten the same drink over at the sports bar across the way for a fraction of the price.

My two girlfriends and I went to try this place before a movie. We were only interested in coffee and dessert. After we were seated the waiter handed us a menu and listed off the desserts. We all ordered small espresso beverages. I asked for a chocolate latte which was not on the menu. When the second waiter came by he brought our drinks: two large drinks and a small hot chocolate. I said that I wanted espresso in the hot chocolate as I had asked for a latte. He seemed displeased and insisted that this was what I had ordered. I asked him if he wouldn't mind putting a shot of espresso in it. He said nothing and walked away with my drink and returned the same drink with a shot of espresso floating on top. We then ordered "gelato" which turned out to be a very disappointing selection of freezer burned ice cream. I asked the waiter if they made the gelato in house. He said no so I asked what company he got it from to which he did not know (this guy turned out to be the owner) , I then asked him if it was just ice cream and he walked away without answering me. When we brought up that it was freezer burned the first waiter (owner) said we would need to pay the bill but we could just not leave a tip if we wanted to save 15-20%. He completely dismissed all of our complaints and inquisitions on top of being rather snide. I would not suggest this place to anyone unless you are looking for bad service in a restaurant where the waiters do not know English well enough to distinguish your order correctly. I love eating at restaurants with a European feel and authentic attributes, however, my experience here left me feeling accosted and demeaned. I will not be returning to cafe pino, ever.

I love this place! We've been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. The service is excellent, the atmosphere is pleasant, the presentation is on point, and the food is high quality. They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner: at breakfast, try the Nordic Platter and if you want a great wood fired pizza, go for the Prosciutto with Arugula!
Yummy food and good service. I had the tuna sandwich which was a nice change from the normal mayo soaked versions you get at most places.

Owners are very welcoming. Food was great and they were very accommodating with my few special requests. Atmosphere was nice, nice spot for a movie date night or just casual lunch. I will be coming back for sure.

Warning - if not on the menu ask for the price for anything and everything.  They love to push specials. For example we were charged $19 for a salad "special" with roasted vegetables and chicken which consisted of of about 90% lettuce, maybe 1 asparagus spear, one small tomato and one mushroom and 1/4 of a small chicken breast. The vegetable pizza $15 tasted OK but very scant in vegetables - about the same as the salad and did I mention we were charged $2 extra for garlic on the pizza (which they asked us if they wanted - no extra charge specified). Won't be back.

We go here for lunch every time we visit my Mom in Arizona.  We always get the same thing because we love it so much.  The Asparagus Soup to start and also a Cesar salad.  Then we get the 4 cheese pizza and my mom makes her own combo pizza.  It is so good.  It is Italian pizza if you like that style.  It is just hard to find it made like this anywhere.  Can't say much about anything else there, but if you go this route you will be very happy.

Pizza was fantastic & service was excellent! They also have an amazing almond cake that is probably my favorite dessert anywhere. I usually come in pretty late, & it has been sold out from time to time in the past, so I recommend calling ahead to make sure they have it in stock. I often come in right before seeing a movie @ the theatre next door, & when I tell them I am in a hurry, they always bring the food & bill asap. Very good Sicilian pizza. Great place, great people!

I went here with my wife, my brother and sister in law. Good service. The Creme brulee was really good as well as the rum cake (Im not a fan of rum but everyone else loved it) overall it was a nice experience with a chic aesthetic.

Significantly overpriced for very ordinary fare. $18 for bland shrimp and pasta, $15 for modestly sized (tho apparently tasty) pizza. The ambiance is agreeable, but the mean portions mimic fine dining, and prices head that way too.  Couldn't complain about the speed: we ordered and food arrived in 3 or 4 minutes (pizza took a little longer). It's as if the kitchen knew already....  V Cheeky to charge the Scottsdale mark-up when it's not even in Scottsdale. Cafe Pinothankyou.

The food here was pretty good! I ordered the creamy asparagus soup. It was DELISH! The bread could have been a little better. It was somewhat hard. I like the overall decor of this restaurant. ONE thing I did NOT like was the layout of the bathrooms,. In the women's restroom the toilet aligned perfectly with the gap in the stall door... so if someone were to walk in they would be able to see you sitting on the toilet. I was thankful enough that nobody walked in.

Went here after the movies to have a quick dinner because it was conveniently located. Learn my lesson about always asking the prices on specials and reading the fine print so you don't get duped. There were two specials: one, a pasta Bolognese with sausage. We asked how much and was told $18. The second was a pasta with olive oil, garlic, chicken and shrimp. Made the wrong assumption that it may be slightly higher because of the shrimp but roughly in the range. When the check arrived, we found that we were charged $18 for the pasta with olive oil and garlic, plus an additional five dollars for the chicken plus an additional seven dollars for the shrimp. Hence, total cost for one SMALL bowl of olive oil pasta with chicken and shrimp was $30. With a small portion sizes, we asked for some bread and olive oil. Later, we discovered the three dollar charge for the four small slices of bread, totaling six dollars because we naïvely asked for two because there were six of us. Their pizza is good tasting; I"ll give em that. The problem I have with this place is the lack of disclosure, what feels like being nickeled and dimed, extremely mediocre tasting pasta in return for fine dining prices, and a proprietor who acts like it's your problem not his. No wonder there was only three tables seated at 7:30 on a Wednesday night in a town filled with awesome restaurants. We will never return.

Service was Outstanding!! Food was outstanding!! Walked by this place last week and had to try it after lookin at the menu and talking with the owner. Came back and found a hidden gem!! My father and I will be back to share this with our friends and family!

Excellent service and food. You can watch them kneading the bread dough and the wood fire oven. The atmosphere is open and spacious. It feels like you are sitting on a beautiful European patio even thought you are out of the Arizona sun. Love this place. We have to come here anytime we are this way

This dinner was absolutely delicious. There were two of us and one of us wanted to try something from the "breakfast all day" menu. I wanted something dinnery. We each got our wish and what a delight our meals were.  I have had Steak au poivre at a lot of restaurants both in the US and in France. This steak au poivre at Pino was as good as any dish I had in France, it was so flavorful and peppery. It was just excellent.  Not everyone likes fennel. I'm one of those who loves fennel. We shared a salad that was fennel & avocado with a very lemony dressing. I loved it. My breakfast guy thought it was too lemony. But then, he ordered breakfast for dinner so take that from whence it comes.  Ok, then my guy got an omelette for dinner. I have to say, it looked really good. The fact that this place has the confidence to serve breakfast all day and a French Steak staple at the same time, says a lot about a restaurants ability to not take itself too seriously, while at the same time, serving seriously great food.  All and all, we will definitely be back.
Food was okay, but staff is RUDE. Still trying to figure out how I was charged $15 for what should have been $8.95 as lunch special. A bowl of mediocre pasta for $15? Definitely not worth it.
Cafepino never lets us down. It is consistently good. We love the Lasagna and the Tuna Fish Sandwich. The Margarita pizza is excellent as well.

This is a great place to stop in for an intimate dinner or a bite before a movie. We went in and got a sandwich and a pizza, a glass of cab sauv and a mojito. The only confusing thing were how many people attended to our table. The pizza was just okay, but the hubs sandwich was delicious. I would go back and order some pasta, anytime. Would definitely recommend

I feel bad that I am giving this such a poor rating because my friend (and now fellow Yelper), Shari V., really seems to like this restaurant.  However, the wine menu is extremely limited, in my opinion, and the food was terrible.  I have a friend, Michael C., who said to me once that it is not fair to rate a restaurant based on only one visit but...  I can't help it.  I had only a half grilled veggie sandwich (because I was sharing), and I couldn't even choke that down.  "Shoe leather" is what comes to mind.  With so many other good restaurants, I would not suggest anyone waste their time with this one.

The owner was rude and provided terrible service. When I mentioned that water was poured into my daughter's Sprite he shrugged his shoulders and never did anything about it, we had to pull another staff member over to fix it.  He told my sister-in-law to "breath" twice when she complained that my brother got a dish he did not order.  He then ground black pepper on her dish after she asked him to stop.  Horrible!

hilarious how most of the lower reviews are fairly consistent ...   yes, the bald lookin french dude, who i found was the co owner has to work on his service...  sad that he even had the guts to write me a foul note that i had to swallow some service or whatever that means... shrugs* it is what it is...  how do u expect others to venture within if you write notes as such? i will fwd it to those who are interested... just cause im nice:)  food was mediocre to say the very least .... prices are high, and honestly, even though it looks as if a fair gem from afar, there's a reason why people write poor reviews ...   def NOT comin back.
The food, wine and service were all excellent!!! Fast and friendly service.  The salad was delicious and fresh baked bread. Definitely will be going back. The patio is very cozy and rather nice.

Horrible experience! We decided to try this place before we went to a concert at MIM. Was there 1 and 1/2 hours before show. Very gruff server ( owner) took order and we told him we had a concert. Ordered a Caesar Salad and he asked if we wanted anchovies. We said " great" another server asked if we would like some bread. We said "fine" although we really didn't care. We also ordered two pizzas, the salad arrived and it was delicious hence the one star. Then we waited and waited and waited, pizzas never arrived 45 minutes later, we kept asking and were told varous excuses, finally we ran out of time and asked for our check. Owner told us " fine but you are paying for the pizzas"  my friend said " we are not,we told you four times we had concert tickets " then the owner told my friend( who was very nice) that he will b kicked out of restaurant. Check came without charge but had two high charges for bread and anchovies. We will never go back and didn't deserve this treatment from owner. At least the concert was wonderful.

I would not recommend eating here. It's close to the movie theater so after the movies, we walked over to look at a menu and to find out their closing time so that we could plan dinner later. The bald Italian guy is either the owner or manager. I was asking the lady who greeted us at the door about the hours when he came over asked the two of us to follow him to be seated and when I said that we were not eating just yet, he rolled his eyes at us, waved a dismissive hand flap and walked off talking about us. Got a few feet away and gave us another angry look.  The lady tried to apologize for his actions.  I have traveled the world and the US. Good food don't overcome bad behavior and the funny thing is today is Christmas. Just a nasty person. Rude, rude, rude.

Our first visit here and I was impressed! Service was quick and seemed like a little tiny Gordon Ramsey style cafe. It was a vey good team working and it seemed like the owners were a part of that team. We got the Carmel macchiato and it was so good! The oven cooked pizza- Sicilian with capers. Mmmmm. Everything seemed fresh and healthy. The desserts looked amazing as well but had to save that for our next visit. If you aren't hungry at least go here for some coffee & dessert or a glass of wine and cheese platter! Unique little place! Happy we tried this place out!

Okay peeps. It's been long coming. Cafepino finally gets a five star rating from us after announcing a free wifi rollout in their european style locale next week. Very refreshing after getting tired of all our franchise places. It's time for you workaholics to leave the beaten path and settle in to your new home. Bring your laptops and share the buzz among only your closest friends. I don't want to regret telling you and winding up not getting a (hot) spot anymore ;-)  I just heard that they have breakfast now on Saturdays and Sundays until 4:00 PM. My kinda peeps :-)

I had a similar experience to Emily and Steve (see reviews below) I ordered a plain pappardelle pasta with tomato sauce which was $18 and a drink $9. They asked if I wanted bread or a house salad I said sure not knowing that would be an extra $9. The food seems fresh but nobody likes to be nickel and dimed. I tried the tiramisu which was lacking in flavor for another $8. The place itself is clean and the staff is 'attentive' for lack of a better word. They seem impatient and the whole experience felt rushed even though they were not busy at the time. The people that came in after me even left before me. The lunch special might be worth a try if you wanted to check out the food without spending a ton.
I absolutely love the food here! I've never had anything off the menu that I didn't like -- and their sangrias are hands down the BEST in town (and did I mention they have them all the time?!)

I will be going back to try breakfast and lunch. the dinner and dessert were amazing. if you like salmon, try the smoked salmon penne. food is so fresh and delicious. the staff is unbelievably friendly and efficient. thank you Paco for a great night.

Had an excellent salmon fettuccine, and a delicious eclair slice. The decor was very trendy, and the selection of coffees was very nice.  The only regrettable thing was that my mom got the home made lemonade.  Is in you pour water and sugar into lemon juice.  Good concept, but it was too sour for me.  Other than that the experience was very pleasant, and we even got a little chat from the owner.

A superior dining experience at Pino! My steak salad was out of this world flavorful. The staff is very attentive and polite. There is a variety on the menu with many delights to select from. The decor is inviting for all ages. I would encourage anyone to stop in to enjoy an unique dining experience. Your palate will most definitely be satisfied.

Nice setting and a great "organic"menu. Pizza is wood fired thin crust, mmmmm. Family run business is very sweet. Menu is full of great food! This day and age you pay for great food and Cafepino is no exception. Also I found a great favorite of mine that is not found easily anywhere in Scottsdale in any Italian restaurant... SPUMONI Gelato! So, I'll be coming back! Atmosphere mid day is very pleasant, music is soothing and the temp is great.

When was the last time your table was bused between courses in any restaurant?  I mean -- wiped down, new utensils, napkins, etcetera?  We came here last week, after going to Cine' Capri. We searched Yelp for a nearby restaurant, to try something different and came across Cafepino.  It didn't register to us at all and we thought we knew the area.   As we were leaving, we noticed it on the left. Could it be Cafepino?  Because of the dark tinted windows and trees, we've always walked past it and never thought to go in. Stupid, because 'Pino is a special kind of place.  The family that owns and runs 'Pino is from France. In fact, the original restaurant was started in Paris in 1958 and is still going strong. As I mentioned, it was the busing of tables that started a conversation with one of the owners. As we came in and looked at the posted menu, he encouraged us to stay in a Gallic sort of way, and we're glad we did!  We ordered their 'Pino Garden Salad ($9.00) that came with a flavorful light balsamic vinaigrette that was just right.  When we ordered, we told them we were going to share and without instruction, two plates were brought along with the salad. I know this might appear minor, but it gives you an idea of their professionalism. The wait staff is a ever watchful tag team effort. Very French!  As we were finished, two employees cleaned our table and our pizza arrived.  The Margherita ($14.00), was very good.  We ordered it half garlic for a $2.00 up-charge. Next time, we'll try the 'Pino's pizza with black olives. That's what the table next to us had and it looked good!  When the bill came, we thought we were getting away with something special, since it was only $25.00, before taxes and tip.  I've noticed on the bottom of the check, it says: "CAFEPINO, it's something else!"  We would agree.    It also teaches you to search Yelp, even when you know an area for new places. If we didn't, we would of turned right to our car, and not left. In the process, we would have missed a great little restaurant.  We'll be back.   Enjoy!

My GF and I were very regular customers here for the last eight months. The owner would always stop and talk to us, then one day my GF goes in without me and he proceeds to hit on her and ask her out. How unprofessional can you get? Gentlemen I wouldn't recommend bringing your ladies here!

Food is ok, interesting pizza combos.  Waiter service was great, except food for our party of six was served over 15 minutes as each item was prepared.  Not great for a celebration dinner as it would have been nice to eat together.  Everything is a la carte, even the bread!!  Pricey for a pizza place, $265 for six.  Won't go back.

What a bummer, service was minimal, food was eh.  I had been to Cafe Pino once before and after tonight, I won't be coming back.  Came in for dinner with a girlfriend.  I met her there and got there about 15 min early so I decided to sit down in a booth.  The restaurant had one party inside and 2 on the patio. Place was dead.  Well, it was a Wednesday night.  The booth seats are close to being ripped apart.  They were all cracked. Glad I was wearing jeans, if I was wearing a skirt or shorts I know that seat would have been uncomfortable.  So I was seated by an employee and waited for 12 minutes to get someone to come to my table to ask if I wanted a drink or water.  My friend showed up and a it took another 5 minutes for a server to come to the table to see if she wanted a drink. She ordered a glass of wine.... Oh, they are all out of that kind.  It's a Wednesday and the place is empty, how can you be out of a certain kind of wine?!  We were given 2 menus.  One was the specials that was a front and back laminated that looked to be printed with a home printer in Times New Roman and the other menu looked to be professionally printed.  It was just confusing.  My girlfriend had been there a couple of times before and these specials were the same ones.  We did get bread with oil and vinegar.  Bread was nothing to brag about, it was flat and hard.  We both ordered the Pasta Tuscan with chicken. She ordered hers spicy.  Which was not.  But she said she liked it. I enjoyed mine as well.  While we were having dinner we kept hearing this banging.  We looked around thinking we would find a kid making the noise like banging a booster seat.  Come to find out it was an employee sweeping into a dust pan. This was around 8:30  and there were more people in the restaurant.  The acoustics in the restaurant are not great so everything echoes and having this employee making noise was annoying as hell.  He stopped for a bit then he started up again.  We looked at the dessert menu and the server gave a couple recommendations.  I asked what flavors the gelato was and he said it is a surprise.  But if I had an allergy to let him know. We ordered cookies and cream, server said its a warm chocolate chip cookie with ice cream.  It was 3 hard chocolate chip cookies with nuts (glad I didn't have a peanut allergy).  It also had chocolate, vanilla and a chocolate chip gelato. The gelato was very good.  The hard over cooked cookies eh, could have done without.  Should have been a warm soft cookie to go with the gelato. While we are eating our dessert, with other customers in the restaurant, the employees are putting the chairs on top of the tables.  Bang, bang, bang.... that employee is sweeping again. He was sweeping around us , I thought he was going to ask for us to put our feet up to clean underneath the table. Dude!?!?! It's loud, do that when your customers leave!!!! We paid the bill and at 9:40, the lights went bright, ok ok we get it, you want us to leave.  I felt like we were in a club at closing time and they turn the lights on to tell people to leave.  4 stars for the pasta dish and gelato and no stars for service, bread and hard cookies.  Learn to give your customers a good experience!

Never got a chance to eat in this place. Hostess took our name and told us 10 min no longer to sit. 25 min later which wasn't the problem a man I think the owner grabbed two different couples that had just walked in and sat them. I thought it was inconsiderate of him since the hostess had a list of patrons under control, it bad business to take others in front of people waiting when your not a fine dining reservation restaurant! Would never step inside this place again even if food was great and free! One star is only because it's still open and not out of business yet!

I was here recently during the Phoenix Film Festival and really enjoyed it.  This struck me as a nice sit-down kind of place, so the order/pay at the counter and clip a number to your table thing doesn't necessarily "go" with the overall decor, but I guess it works.  Two girl friends and I shared the caprese salad and the Four Seasons pizza minus the ham (okay so maybe we only had three seasons), and both were delicious.  The pizza was very flavorful and tasted like it was baked in a wood-burning oven.  Thanks, Cafepino, for having a bottle of olive oil on each table -- we definitely consumed our share of "healthy" fat by sopping it up with the pizza crust.    The service was extremely attentive.  It seemed like every time I took a sip of water, someone immediately filled my glass all the way back up.  That seemed a tad odd, but certainly preferable to no refills at all!   I'll definitely have to go back and try the wine and desserts.
Always a solid choice. Good food and service. Makes you feel like you're in a neighborhood restaurant in France.

Came here for lunch today and the place was dead. We should have left but we decided to stay for lunch because we were starving. I have to say that Cafepino wasn't the first place we wanted to eat at today, we went to TeaLight Cafe but had to leave because it was PACKED OUT and there were no tables, hence our decision to eat at Cafepino. We sat down only to realize how expensive this place is!!! Holy cow, I mean come on, not even a "lunch special menu." I can't imagine spending $15 for pasta at lunch time. We did order a pizza which was good, we shared.  This place has potential if they offered LUNCH SPECIALS! There are tons of office buildlings across the way and I can't imagine why this restaurant shouldn't be packed out at 12:30 on a business day.  And we should have checked the price on the old ice tea they served, $3.00, YIKES.  Kids menu was priced high too, $7 starting.  We will not be back, sorry.

The owner comes off as rude but he is just abrupt, we were not sure if we were going to stay but we saw the coffee menu and wanted to try it.  I think the owner/owners come  off as rude and it is mostly because of a different culture. Creme brûlée is amazing. Mousse is amazing. Espresso is amazing. You can tell management is tough on waiters.  The cappuccino was impressive, the espresso was strong and robust, it actually kept me up way past midnight!  We didn't have a meal but their menu looked promising so we'll be back!

I love the food at Cafe Pino!  I have to comment on Heather's review.  She mentioned that the owner kept asking if she was okay and that it got annoying.  The owner's at Cafe Pino are Italian, that's just how they are.  If you ever get an opportunity to visit Italy, you'd better get used to that kind of service.  That's just how they are.  I do agree that the ordering system is a little confusing though.  Try the Sangria!  It's homemade and amazing!!!
This place is the best. They are quick and have great food. My wife and I visit here frequently!
This place was delicious and the service was very professional and attentive. Would definitely recommend! And it is so convenient to go right before a movie at Harkins next door!

Friend suggested meeting here for casual Italian. Amazing, delicious, excellent personal service and incredibly high-end clean casual. Antipasto appetizer was enough for a full meal.  Two of us had specialty salads as meals - delicious. One had a pizza - stunning. The creme brûlée was nothing more than authentic leaving the taste buds wanting more.  Music and ambience delightful and can't wait to sit on the beautiful patio with a bottle of wine when the weather warms up. We definitely will be returning and would recommend this restaurant to any of our friends with the pickiest of tastes.  Well done!

A friend brought me here boasting the best pizza in the world. My expectations were not high, but still--I was intrigued by this slanderous boast.   The place is very cute for being adjacent to a shopping mall. Shopping malls just give me the impression that a place will be packed with hordes of awkward teenagers. I think that's the old age in me creeping in though.  Cafe Pino is probably a decent date spot. It's cozy and modern and the service is pretty top notch. The pizza. It's o.k. Thin crust, brick oven pizza. The sauce tastes a little weird to me, but other than that--it's a decent pizza, just not the best in the world.

I really do love Cafepino.   the servic e for one, is excellent. the owner, a polite Frechman, is always there to greet his customers and to oversee his business, which in this economy is the watermark of a good business owner. He is also very helpful when it comes to menu decisions. The wait staff, however, is a little lackluster. They simply bring your food, and then leave, and make little to no conversation at all. I've never had complications/bad experience at Cafepino, and the only problem is perhaps their waitstaff.   The food is excellent. A little pricey, but good nonetheless. Usually while I'm there, I get this creamy tomato sauce penne pasta dish- I can't remeber exactly what it's called, the Ceasar salad- which is fresh, crispy, cold and has the right balance of cheese/lettuce/dressing, or the pizzas, which are best when they are cooked crispy!   The atmosphere is cozy but modern, and is a good place for date night, or simply just a night out.   If you're willing to pay a tad more for some good food, then Cafepino is worth it!

There is no better italian food in the Phoenix area than CafePino. Such a great atmosphere and hospitality as well.  Owners are always at the site to recommend specials and customize order for you. Highly recommended.

I think this place is good. I've had pizza here twice. My only complaint is the beer selection. They charge Scottsdale prices, but they don't offer what other Scottsdale eateries can offer. Considering this place is next to a movie theater and several more affordable options with better beer choices - quite literally in the same parking lot - I'm not sure how long they will survive here.

It's always nice to be able to write a good review. Despite being in a strip center next door to Harkins, Cafe Pino has a real bistro feel to it. A pretty varied menu, all I can answer to is their pizzas. Nice Roman style with thin crispy crust, a good sauce and a variety of toppings.  I've come in on my own several times, and the service is always warm and inviting.

Pino's customer service was exceptional throughout my visit. The French dip was good but the pizza is amazing and the creme brûlée was perfect. The five stars would be well earned from just the service alone but the good lived up to expectations as well. Thanks.

Cafepino is a marriage between French and Italian cuisine. It borders the Cine Capri Theatre. The main dinning room is spacious with the tables reasonably spaced apart so you have some privacy and elbow room. They have a glorious outdoor patio with small trees and greenery climbing the trellises on the perimeter of the patio. The lighting at night is perfect for enjoying a meal. This is a great place for date night.  The restaurant that we decided to go to on the Saturday night before Easter in Phoenix was closing at 7pm (who does that?), so we decided to head back home to Scottsdale for Plan B. We decided to try Cafepino out since the Yelp reviews were so good. My wife and I really enjoyed our meal as we dined al fresco. The outdoor dining area reminded me of Van Gogh's painting "Cafe Terrace Arles". The service was perfect. I had the french dip with au jus, french fries and a salad. All of this was served on one plate. The salad was lightly caressed with salad dressing with mainly greens; it was fabulous. Although the fries were not my favorite, they did the job. The French Dip was perfect as their homemade bread added to the flavor of the meat and au jus. I would definitely order this entree again.

Pino is a European Pizza Chain. The owners are French and opened the only Pino in the United States. The menu offers wood fired Italian Style Pizzas, appetizers, sandwiches, many salads, entrees, specials and some French Food. Pino truly doesn't feel like a chain. The owners are very welcoming and all the food is made by scratch.   I had the lunch sized Bonita Salad. I received a nicely prepared piece of grilled wild salmon over a romaine salad with avocado and a few other things. The salad was indeed good.  My husband had the French Dip on their house made bread. Again indeed good.  At this point I'm undecided between 3-4 stars. Atmosphere is very good, Service is very welcoming, charming and good. Food is good but not exciting. So I try dessert and order the Lemon Meringue.  The Lemon Meringue is obviously house made. but had a soggy crust and thick not so lemony curd. The meringue was kinda flat and too chewy.  After dessert I felt this was closer to three stars.  3.5 stars just like the Yelp average at this time.

Only been once so more of a full review will follow.  I was waiting for a movie and got an espresso because I'm C&C, yeah that's right, cultured and classy.  Coffee was very good, menu looked great as did the actual food I saw people eating around me while I was staring creepily.
